content: Search Free Trial Get Demo Data443 Announces Broad Support for Leading Open-Source Cloud Unix Leader June 13, 2022 Based on Increasing Customer Demand for Cloud Unix Services  Data443 Certifies its Leading Data Transport Product Research Triangle Park, NC, June 13, 2022  Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc . Data443 or the Company OTCPK ATDS , the leading data security and privacy software company for ALL THINGS DATA SECURITY, today announced support for major cloud Unix provider on its data platform Data443  Data Placement Manager product. Our Data443  Data Placement Manager product line continues to grow above expectations, and with this growth comes new requirements and expectations. Our customers have been asking for broader support on the public and hybrid cloud  as they begin to leverage all sorts of configurations to supplement their business. We officially support commercial and open-source versions of leading Unix implementations on all major cloud services vendors  including Microsoft  Azure, Google  Cloud Platform, Amazon  Web Services, stated Data443 CEO  Founder Jason Remillard. Leveraging the public cloud on-premises or even in a multi-public-cloud configuration is smart design and smart business. Our leading financial services clients who demand the best in availability, performance, and stability utilize these technologies to deliver their services. We are proud to deliver these capabilities directly via the public cloud providers and give our clients a path towards their hybrid-cloud implementations, concluded Mr. Remillard. The new capability is immediately available for customers of Data443  Placement Manager at online at  About Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. OTC ATDS  is an industry leader in All Things Data Security, providing software and services to enable secure data across local devices, networks, cloud, and databases, at rest and in flight. With over 10,000 customers in over 100 countries, Data443 provides a modern approach to data governance and security by identifying and protecting all sensitive data regardless of location, platform, or format. Our industry-leading framework helps customers prioritize risk, identify security gaps, and implement overall data protection and privacy management strategies. For more information, please visit  To learn more about Data443, please watch our video introduction on our YouTube channel  Forward-Looking Statements The statements contained in this release that are not historical facts are forward-looking statements as defined in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Words such as may, will, could, should, expect, plan, project, intend, anticipate, believe, estimate, predict, potential, pursuant, target, continue, and similar expressions are intended to identify such forward-looking statements. The statements in this press release that are not historical statements, including statements regarding Data443s plans, objectives, future opportunities for Data443s services, future financial performance and operating results and any other statements regarding Data443s future expectations, beliefs, plans, objectives, financial conditions, assumptions or future events or performance that are not historical facts, are forward-looking statements within the meaning of the federal securities laws. These statements are not guarantees of future performance and are subject to numerous risks, uncertainties, and assumptions, many of which are beyond Data443s control, and which could cause actual results to differ materially from the results expressed or implied by the statements. These statements are not guarantees of future performance and involve risks, uncertainties and assumptions that are difficult to predict, and include, without limitation, results of litigation, settlements and investigations actions by third parties, including governmental agencies volatility in customer spending global economic conditions ability to hire and retain personnel loss of, or reduction in business with, key customers difficulty with growth and integration of acquisitions product liability cybersecurity risk anti-takeover measures in our charter documents and, the uncertainties created by the ongoing outbreak of COVID-19. These and other important risk factors are described more fully in our reports and other documents filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission the SEC, including in i Part I, Item 1A. Risk Factors, in our Registration Statement on Form 10 filed with the SEC on January 11, 2019 and amended on April 24, 2019 ii Part I, Item 1A. Risk Factors, in our Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the SEC on March 31, 2022 and, iii subsequent filings. Undue reliance should not be placed on the forward-looking statements in this press release, which are based on information available to us on the date hereof. Except as otherwise required by applicable law, we undertake no obligation to publicly update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether because of new information, future events, or otherwise. DATA443 is a registered trademark of Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. All product names, trademarks and registered trademarks are property of their respective owners. All company, product and service names used in this website are for identification purposes only. Use of these names, trademarks and brands does not imply endorsement. For further information Follow us on Twitter  Follow us on Facebook  Follow us on LinkedIn  Follow us on YouTube  Signup for our Investor Newsletter  Investor Relations Contact Matthew Abenante  919.858.6542 Try it for Free Instant Data Classification Cyren URL Category Chacker Prev Data443 Announces Industry-First Hybrid Classifications Taxonomy at the Gartner Security  Risk Management Summit 2022 Data443 Returns to Sponsor Black Hat USA Conference Next Company Partners Resources Investor Relations Products Freeware Demo Solutions Contact Us Privacy Management Service by Data443

analyses.comprehensive:
### Comprehensive Analysis of Security-Related Content

The provided content is a press release from Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. announcing its support for leading open-source cloud Unix providers. Below is an analysis of the security-related aspects of this content based on the requested categories.

---

### 1. **Key Security Features and Their Benefits to Users**

The press release highlights the following security features and their benefits:

- **Broad Support for Cloud Unix Platforms**:  
  Data443’s Data Placement Manager product now supports major open-source and commercial Unix implementations across leading cloud providers such as Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and Amazon Web Services (AWS).  
  **Benefits**:  
  - **Flexibility**: Customers can operate in hybrid or multi-cloud environments, allowing them to choose the best configuration for their business needs.  
  - **Scalability**: Support for public and hybrid cloud setups enables organizations to scale their operations efficiently.  
  - **Reliability**: Unix-based systems are known for their stability, and integrating them with cloud platforms ensures high availability and performance.

- **Data Governance and Security Framework**:  
  Data443 emphasizes its ability to identify and protect sensitive data across devices, networks, cloud platforms, and databases, regardless of location, platform, or format.  
  **Benefits**:  
  - **Comprehensive Data Protection**: The framework prioritizes risk, identifies security gaps, and implements data protection and privacy management strategies.  
  - **Cross-Platform Consistency**: Customers can secure their data whether it’s at rest or in transit, ensuring a unified approach to data security.

---

### 2. **Compliance Certifications and Regulatory Adherence**

The press release does not explicitly mention compliance certifications or regulatory adherence. However, it is implied that the company adheres to industry standards and compliance requirements due to its focus on serving industries like financial services, which are heavily regulated. 

- **Industries Served**:  
  Data443 mentions its work with leading financial services clients, who are subject to stringent regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, PCI-DSS, and SOC2). While the press release does not list specific certifications, the fact that the company serves these industries suggests that its products comply with relevant standards.  

- **Forward-Looking Statements and Risk Factors**:  
  The press release includes forward-looking statements and a section on risk factors, which mention compliance with federal securities laws and filings with the SEC. This indicates that the company is aware of and adheres to regulatory requirements, though specific certifications are not detailed.

---

### 3. **User-Focused Security Recommendations**

While the press release does not provide explicit user-focused security recommendations, the content implies best practices for customers:

- **Leverage Hybrid and Multi-Cloud Configurations**:  
  Users are encouraged to adopt hybrid or multi-cloud architectures to enhance flexibility, availability, and performance. This approach can also reduce dependency on a single provider, improving resilience against outages or cyberattacks.

- **Utilize Unix-Based Systems**:  
  Unix systems are known for their security, stability, and performance. Users can benefit from using these systems in cloud environments to ensure robust security and reliability.

- **Monitor and Optimize Data Placement**:  
  Data443’s Data Placement Manager allows users to optimize data placement across cloud platforms, ensuring that data is stored and managed securely and efficiently.

---

### 4. **Technical Security Implementation Details**

The press release focuses on high-level functionality rather than detailed technical security implementation. However, the following can be inferred:

- **Integration with Leading Cloud Platforms**:  
  Data443’s support for Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud Platform, and Amazon Web Services indicates seamless integration with these platforms. This allows users to leverage the security features of these cloud providers while managing data placement and security through Data443’s tools.

- **Support for Open-Source and Commercial Unix**:  
  By supporting both open-source and commercial Unix versions, Data443 ensures compatibility with a wide range of environments, making it easier for users to adopt secure and stable systems.

- **Data Transport and Placement**:  
  The Data Placement Manager product is designed to transport and place data securely across cloud and hybrid environments, ensuring that data is protected during transit and at rest.

---

### 5. **Data Protection Measures**

The press release emphasizes Data443’s focus on data security and privacy. Key data protection measures include:

- **Data Governance Framework**:  
  Data443’s framework identifies and protects sensitive data across devices, networks, cloud platforms, and databases, regardless of location or format.

- **Hybrid and Multi-Cloud Support**:  
  By supporting hybrid and multi-cloud configurations, Data443 ensures that data is stored and managed securely across different environments, reducing the risk of data breaches.

- **Cross-Platform Consistency**:  
  The company’s tools ensure consistent data protection policies are applied across all platforms and formats, minimizing gaps in security.

---

### 6. **Best Practices for End Users**

Based on the content, the following best practices can be recommended to end users:

1. **Adopt Hybrid or Multi-Cloud Architectures**:  
   Use hybrid or multi-cloud configurations to enhance flexibility, availability, and resilience. This approach can also reduce dependency on a single provider.

2. **Leverage Unix-Based Systems**:  
   Unix systems are known for their stability and security. Consider using these systems in cloud environments to ensure robust performance and security.

3. **Implement Data Governance Policies**:  
   Use Data443’s tools to implement data governance policies that identify, classify, and protect sensitive data across all platforms and formats.

4. **Monitor and Optimize Data Placement**:  
   Regularly monitor and optimize data placement across cloud platforms to ensure data is stored and managed securely and efficiently.

5. **Stay Informed About Compliance Requirements**:  
   If operating in regulated industries (e.g., financial services), stay informed about compliance requirements and ensure that your data management practices align with industry standards.

---

### Conclusion

The press release highlights Data443’s commitment to providing secure and flexible data management solutions for hybrid and multi-cloud environments. While it does not explicitly detail compliance certifications or technical security implementation, the content implies adherence to industry standards and best practices. Users are encouraged to leverage Data443’s tools to enhance data security, governance, and compliance in their operations.
analyses.product:
Data443's Data Placement Manager offers comprehensive security features designed to meet the needs of enterprises managing data across diverse cloud and hybrid environments. Here's a structured overview of its capabilities and benefits:

### Key Features and Capabilities:
1. **Broad Compatibility**: Supports major cloud providers (Azure, AWS, GCP) and both commercial and open-source Unix systems, ensuring flexibility and seamless integration.
2. **Hybrid-Cloud Support**: Enables secure data transport and management across on-premises and multi-cloud setups, crucial for maintaining control and security.
3. **Data Transport Security**: Likely includes encryption during transit and at rest, ensuring data protection as it moves across environments.
4. **Integration with Security Tools**: Compatible with existing security frameworks, allowing for unified threat management and incident response.

### User Benefits:
1. **Flexible Deployment**: Customers can choose their preferred cloud provider without compromising on security.
2. **Centralized Management**: Simplifies data transport workflows, reducing complexity and the risk of human error.
3. **High Availability**: Features like redundancy and failover ensure data accessibility and system stability, critical for industries like finance.

### Protection Measures:
1. **Encryption**: Secures data both during transport and storage.
2. **Access Controls**: Likely includes role-based access to ensure only authorized personnel can manage data.
3. **Auditing and Logging**: Provides logs for compliance audits and incident identification.

### Compliance and Certifications:
1. **Regulatory Compliance**: Supports standards such as GDPR and HIPAA, essential for industries with strict data handling requirements.
2. **Industry Best Practices**: Compliance with security standards implies adherence to established data protection protocols.

### Integration Capabilities:
1. **Compatibility with Security Systems**: Works with SIEM tools, firewalls, and IAM systems for a robust security ecosystem.
2. **Unified Interface**: Reduces complexity by offering a single interface for managing multiple environments.

### Technical Specifications and Requirements:
1. **Cloud Provider Compatibility**: Requires accounts with Azure, AWS, or GCP for cloud-based deployments.
2. **System Requirements**: On-prem setups may need specific OS versions or software dependencies, though details are pending confirmation.

### Security Best Practices:
1. **Configuration**: Use strong encryption and set up proper access controls.
2. **Monitoring**: Regularly audit logs and monitor for suspicious activities.
3. **Updates**: Keep cloud environments and software updated to mitigate vulnerabilities.

In summary, Data443's Data Placement Manager offers a secure, flexible solution for enterprises needing to manage data across various environments, ensuring compatibility, security, and compliance.
analyses.user_guidance:
**Security Guidance Based on Data443's Cloud Unix Support**

1. **Security Best Practices:**
   - **Authentication:** Use SSH keys and enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) for enhanced security when accessing Unix systems on cloud platforms. MFA adds an extra layer of verification beyond just a password.
   - **Access Control:** Regularly review and update user permissions to ensure least privilege access.Limit administrative access to only necessary personnel.
   - **System Updates:** Apply security patches and updates promptly to protect against vulnerabilities.
   - **Logging and Monitoring:** Implement logging for all critical activities and monitor for suspicious behavior using tools like Data443's solutions.
   - **Encryption:** Encrypt data both in transit and at rest to safeguard against unauthorized access.

2. **Data Protection Recommendations:**
   - **Data Classification:** Utilize tools like Data443's Data Placement Manager to classify data based on sensitivity, ensuring critical data is more securely protected.
   - **Backups:** Schedule regular, automated backups. Use versioning to easily restore data if needed.
   - **Data Loss Prevention (DLP):** Deploy DLP solutions to monitor and control data movement, especially in hybrid-cloud environments.

3. **Safe Usage Guidelines:**
   - **Phishing Awareness:** Train users to recognize phishing attempts to prevent unauthorized access.
   - **Secure Connections:** Always use secure communication protocols like HTTPS and SSH for remote access.
   - **Permissions:** Set appropriate file and directory permissions using Unix commands like chmod and chown to restrict unnecessary access.

4. **Common Security Risks and Prevention:**
   - **Misconfigurations:** Regularly audit configurations to avoid security loopholes. Tools like Data443 can help identify issues.
   - **Insider Threats:** Implement monitoring tools and programs to detect and prevent internal threats.
   - **Vulnerabilities:** Maintain systems with up-to-date patches and consider vulnerability management solutions for proactive protection.

5. **Privacy Protection Measures:**
   - **Regulatory Compliance:** Ensure compliance with regulations like GDPR and CCPA. Data443 can assist with data governance.
   - **Access Controls:** Restrict data access based on roles and responsibilities to maintain privacy.
   - **Data Minimization:** Only collect necessary data and anonymize where possible. Use secure deletion methods for disposal.
   - **Vendor Contracts:** Ensure third-party providers adhere to privacy standards, using Data443 solutions for oversight.

6. **When to Seek Additional Security Support:**
   - **Complex Setups:** Consult with experts like Data443 when dealing with multi-cloud environments for optimal security configurations.
   - **Security Incidents:** Engage incident response teams if a breach is suspected or detected.
   - **Regular Audits:** Periodically have security audits conducted by professionals to ensure ongoing protection.

By following these guidelines, users of Data443's solutions can enhance their security posture in cloud-based Unix environments.
